title: 0⃣Mining (Hashing)
desc: Deep dive into Bitcoin mining and hashing — how SHA-256 works at the bit level.

msgs.text: How does mining/hashing actually work? Why doesn't each cumulative hash increase the probability of finding the correct hash? Can two blocks be solved at the same time? What is the nonce?
0⃣Mining (Hashing)

Why miners are not closer to the solution as they hash potential solutions:
Explanation by : the problem the miners have to solve is to find a hash of the block header that is less than the target number for that difficulty period. The block header includes the time stamp down to the second. The two other variables that can be changed are the nonce field and the input of the coinbase transaction (can be thought of as a second nonce). Therefore, each second there are a 2^96 different combinations of the block header that can be hashed to try and find a solution (which may not be found by that miner at all that second). The next second the timestamp variable will be different, so all the hashes will be completely different. Since it is impossible to predict patterns based on inputs into the hash, no patterns can be identified over time either. Hope this helps.
Nonce means "number once."
From the Book of Satoshi

What happens if two blocks are solved at the same time? If two blocks are solved at the same time by miners A and B, the chain splits and some miners work from A's block and the others work from B's block. Whichever chain solves the next block becomes the longest and therefore official chain, and the other chain becomes orphaned and dropped.
